title: Importing calendar from windows to linux
content:
• I installed Thunderbird on pop-os linux (flatpack).
  • Copied the *default-release directory from win to pop-os
  • Imported *default-release directory
  • The mail messages came over fine.
  • The calendars from win appear on the left
  • But none of the events or tasks from win appear on pop-os

I followed what steps I've found on line. I thought that if the mail came over, the other data should also be there. It appears at some of the calendar information made it, but not the events, etc.

I don't want to re-enter events manually. Is there something missing above?
creator: 82org

title: New to Thunderbird and very confused
content:
I have 2 email addresses. A personal one (outlook.com) and a business one (live.com). I have set them both up on Thunderbird and they seem to be coming through without any problems.

BUT, I am now the only one who gets the live.com emails (through to my laptop via Thunderbird). Yesterday I alerted my husband that he had a couple of business emails to deal with which he does on his ipad via the mail app, and when he opened it, he had absolutely nothing there where there are normally quite a lot of emails there due to all of the mailing lists that our business has ended up on.

He is not very happy about losing access to his emails and wants me to get rid of Thunderbird which I really dont want to do. Has anyone got any idea why this is happening please? I have spent hours reading about things that say to tick a box that says to leave messages on the server, but I feel I have looked everywhere multiple times and just cant find this box. Thanks in advance.

title: Thunderbird
content:
Hi, since some days i have an issue with the connection to my email provider Strato. I noticed that, when i delete a message from my inbox, it also has been moved from my webmail version in Strato. Which gives issues, since the provider is connected to several devices and programs. For private and business reasons i use both Outlook and Thunderbird on different devices. So, it is not wanted that the mail i handle in Thunderbird (looks like) being mirrored in action at the Webmail from Strato. As said, it lóóks like this happens. Do you know of any setting or way this causes this? I used the above method for many years and never had any issues. But since an update in the 1st half of this year, also due to IMAP settings i expierence issues. This situation is unwanted and Thunderbird should not create changes in my webmail from the provider. Please let me know what you need from me to see how this can be solved. thanks and regards Rob

- i've added pictures which shows the following: image1 Thunderbird: marked message in Inbox image2 Outlook: marked (same) message in Inbox image3 Provider Strato webmail: marked same message in Inbox image4 Outlook: message will be deleted image5 Outlook: message is deleted and moved to Bin image6 Provider Strato: message still in Inbox after resfresh image7 Thunderbird: message will be deleted image8 Thunderbird: message is deleted and moved to Bin image9 Provider Strato: message is deleted after refresh image10 Provider Strato: message is moved from Inbox to Bin

title: Wrong "from" address when sending "Reply to all" answer.
content:
Thunderbird 128.3.0esr (64-bit).

I have several accounts in the client.

Suppose it acc1@mail.com and acc2@mail.com.

Also acc1@mail.com installed somewhere else with another user.

When I receive letter from acc1@mail.com to acc2@mail.com and press "Reply to all" button while acc2@mail.com is active - I'm getting acc1@mail.com in the field "From" but it should be acc2@mail.com.

When i delete acc1@mail.com from installation everything works as expected.

Checked twice settings in outgoing server options - each client has it's own settings.

title: Calendario - Non è più possibile spostare gli eventi del calendario ad altra data trascinandoli con il mouse
content: Buongiorno. Dopo l'aggiornamento di Mozille Thunderbird all'ultima versione (Thunderbird Desktop Version 128.3.0esr, rilasciata il 1 ottobre 2024) ho notato che non è più possibile spostare gli eventi del calendario ad altra data trascinandoli con il mouse. L'unico modo per spostarli è modificare la data tramite il comando "modifica". Suggerisco di apportare una modifica a Thunderbird, così da ripristinare la possibilità di spostare gli eventi del calendario ad altra data semplicemente trascinandoli con il mouse. Grazie molte e cordiali saluti.

title: Non riesco a ricevere mail su Thunderbird desktop di mail outlook.it e outlook.com
content:
Da un pò di tempo a questa parte, non riesco ad inviare mail su Thunderbird desktop da indirizzi @outlook.it e @outlook.com, mi da sempre errore. Come devo impostare server smtp?

Al momento ho le seguenti impostazioni:

Descrizione: Outlook.com (Microsoft) Nome server: smtp.outlook365.com Porta: 587 Nome utente: xxx@hotmail.it Metodo di autenticazione: OAuth2 Sicurezza della connessione: STARTTLS

Continua comunque ad uscirmi errore: Accesso al server smtp.office365.com con nome utente xxx@outlook.it non riuscito.

Vi ringrazio anticipatamente per l'assistenza.

Davide

title: OAuth2 and Thunderbird - Microsoft's Enter code screen is incorrectly displayed for Outlook
content:
Modern Authentication Methods are now needed to continue syncing Outlook Email in Thunderbird. I have changed my POP Mail Server settings for outlook.office365.com to OAuth2, but every time that I attempt to logon, the Microsoft Enter code screen is incorrectly displayed (see image). The necessary 'ok', 'enter', or 'accept' icon is missing, so that whenever I input the required code from my authenticator app, nothing at all happens and then the connection fails.

There are two separate lines shown for inputting the code and this is also abnormal. Unfortunately, neither of them does anything and the same goes for the blank square box, or simply hitting the return key after the code has been entered.

It makes no difference if I delete my Outlook account from Thunderbird and reconfigure the relevant email settings from scratch. I have two Windows 10 laptops with Thunderbird 128.3 and the results are identical on both.

I cannot find a reference to anyone else having this particular problem with Oath2 logins and would appreciate some help.

NB. I have edited out my actual email address which was shown below the Microsoft logo in the image.

Thanks.
creator: MutleyB

title: Hotmail.com settings
content:
my hotmail account just stopped allowing me to sign on. I was directed by microsoft to update my current settings which did not work Any suggestions? failed update procedure was as follows: 

   Microsoft has recently implemented a policy update for new authentication methods.

Mozilla Thunderbird does support Modern Authentication and it is recommended that you ensure you switch to use those settings. Any account that you add to Thunderbird will now automatically setup using the proper settings. You have the following options: Option 1: Update Current Settings 1. Change Thunderbird's server settings: Select ≡>Account Settings. In the left pane, select Server Settings for your Outlook.com or Hotmail.com account. ForAuthentication method, select OAuth2 (instead of Normal password). 2. Change Thunderbird's authentication method for sending messages (SMTP): Select ≡ >Account Settings. In the left pane, select Outgoing Server (SMTP). In the right pane, select your Microsoft account and thenEdit…. <image> For Authentication method, select OAuth2 (instead of Normal password). <image> Select OK to save your changes. Option 2: Remove Current Account and Re-Add If you remove your current account from Thunderbird and then re-add it, the proper settings will be detected, and you will just need to sign in to be properly configured with Modern Authentication and the proper server settings. For detailed information and more content, you can refer to this link: Modern Authentication Methods now needed to continue syncing Outlook Email in non-Microsoft email apps - Microsoft Support Hope this help you, please feel free to let me know how it goes. If there is any deviation in my understanding, please forgive me and provide me with more details. I am more than happy to continue to help you. Best Regards, Addie.C - MSFT | Microsoft Community Support Specialist
creator: cwkilby
